alert.note: Alert for Greater Portland Metro Area (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 5:13PM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Clackamas, southwestern Multnomah and east central Washington Counties through 545 PM PDT... At 513 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over West Slope, or near Portland Downtown, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Portland Downtown, Portland, Beaverton, Tigard, Lake Oswego, Milwaukie, Metzger, Garden Home-Whitford, Oak Hills, West Haven-Sylvan, Cedar Mill, West Slope, Sylvan, Raleigh Hills, Lloyd Center, Cedar Hills, Wilshire Park, Sellwood, University Of Portland and The Oregon Zoo. This includes the following highways in Oregon... Interstate 5 between mile markers 294 and 306. Interstate 84 between mile markers 1 and 3. U.S. Highway 26 west of Portland between mile markers 65 and 73. U.S. Highway 26 east of Portland between mile markers 1 and 4. U.S. Highway 30 west of Portland between mile markers 1 and 5. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
